subject: Re: RoboBox schematic
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Bumping the gain up in the LM386 always seemed to introduce more 
noise for me, and I prefer to use the high impedance op amps as a 
preamp/isolation stage for just about everything audio.  

 Frank-s

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> Thx, Frank, just one question: Why did you use the audio preamp 
stages?
> The gain of the LM386 can be increased from 20 to 200 by connecting 
a
> 100 F capacitor between pins 1 and 8, so an additional preamp 
should be
> unnecessary.
> 
> Stefan
> 
> -- 
> 
> > So others can try this? Use the Speakjet data sheet to configure 
that
> > chip. I just float the SJ's reset pin--not connecting it to 
anything,
> > the idea being that entities can use that to control the chip 
because
> > you can wave your hand over the reset pin and the chip will reset,
> > announcing "Ready".
>  
> >  Frank-S
>
